free_text.Contenu: [b]I. Introduction to non-equilibrium thermodynamics[/b][br/]- Brownian Motion and Einstein relation[br/]- Fokker Planck Equation	[br/]- Boltzmann Equation[br/]- Examples of particle and heat diffusion, relaxation [br/][br/][b]II. Statistical Mechanics of Linear Response[/b][br/]- Kubo Formula[br/]- Fluctuation Dissipation Theorem	[br/]- Markovian Processes	[br/][br/][b]III. Quantum statistical processes[/b][br/]- The quantum Master equation and open quantum systems[br/]- The damped Harmonic oscillator interacting with a non-zero temperature bath[br/]- Two level system in a heat bath, de-phasing processes.[br/]- Quantum stochastic Langevin equations[br/][]	[br/][b]IV. Special topics: applications of stochastic quantum Langevin equations in quantum optics[/b][br/]- Applications of quantum statistical processes and simulation thereof using the "MATLAB" Quantum Optical Toolbox[br/]- Input-output theory Gardiner and Collet[br/]- Applications of stochastic quantum Langevin equations in Quantum Optics:Master equation, Fokker Planck equation for Optical Parametric Oscillator, Ito formalism, Phase diffusion in Lasers[br/]- Thermodynamical noise in Physics and precision measurements (thermorefractive noises, 1/f noise and noise color).[br/]

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: The objective of this course is to understand the mathematical foundations of classical and quantum systems that find themselves out of equilibrium via interactions with a reservoir leading to stochastic processes. In addition to analyzing classical systems and developing a linear response theory and stochastic Langevin equations, the course will also consider quantum systems interaction with a reservoir. The quantum master equation will be introduced and used to describe the interaction of a two-level systems and harmonic oscillators systems. The quantum stochastic Master equation MATLAB toolbox will be introduced to address a variety of open quantum system problems.
